website_summaries.verdict: A durable, warm, and waterproof winter boot that stands up well to cold temperatures – but some sizing inconsistencies.
pros: Warm, have good traction, and designed with high quality materials that keep feet dry
Can keep feet warm and comfortable even in single digit and negative temperatures
They also get top marks for toughness and durability
cons: There may be some inconsistencies in terms of size
They are also a bit looser above the ankles than some other boot styles and some find them bulky

website_summaries.verdict: If you need winter boots that will withstand almost any outdoor conditions, this pair has a lot of practical qualities, but they aren't comfortable on everyone or suited for indoor wear.
pros: Muck Boots are renowned for cold, rain, and snow, and these boots fit the bill, thanks to the rubber waterproof build, durable lugs and thermal foot bed lining
Can be worn by men and women
cons: Some owners gripe about them rubbing uncomfortably against the calf
Sizes run narrow on some individuals with wider feet
Though grippy outdoors, the soles may be slippery on some floor surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Super Rad Boots, wish I cold rate them higher!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I live in a very remote village in Alaska that is only accessible by plane. We are always in the Freezing ocean getting mussels, on muddy trails, or braving the elements to have dinner and play cards with friends. We are in our early 30's and we are HARD on our boots. These boots not only hold up, they keep you warm and dry NO MATTER WHAT it is doing outside! I have tried Tuff Boots, Boggs, etc and we are Hooked on Muck Boots for life! If I could give them 10 stars I would!
customer_reviews.author: Ash N.

customer_reviews.title: Athough Comfortable, cracked and leaking, tread does not last.
customer_reviews.text: These Boots are very comfortable and very waterproof. They get done 3 stars because after 5 months the tread is worn down 75%. I doubt I'll get the year out of them, for the price this is not acceptable. After 6 months they now have a crack Midway in the upper and are leaking plus the inside heel has worn to the point that it chews up my socks. Even heavy duty work socks. Very disappointed because these are comfortable but for $144 not worth even half of that. I've always heard Much boots were the best I guess they have gone cheap like everybody else.
customer_reviews.author: william marshall

customer_reviews.title: Boots run a size large
customer_reviews.text: I liked the Muck boots. They are very well made and look great. The bottoms have a great design and look like they would have great traction. I really liked the way they are made and feel good to walk in. I wore them in the house trying see if I bought the right size. I ordered a size 12, which is my shoe size. Unfortunately they ran a size too big. Based on what I read about sizing I ordered my normal shoe size. I didn't replace them with the size 11 because the price was a lot higher than the original price I paid. I would have given them 5 stars but the sizing was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Love to Read

customer_reviews.title: A 'must have" if you live up north
customer_reviews.text: These boots are extremely well made and absolutely essential for life in northern winter conditions. Comfortable, easy to get on and off, warm enough for nearly all conditions, and waterproof. The boot you need for the day to day nastiness of snow and mush. I normally am a size 11/2 or 12: I got the 12's and the fit is perfect. I'm on my second pair. The first lasted about 5 years under heavy usage, and they are still functional. I just thought I'd replace them before the seals failed.
customer_reviews.author: smallwaters

customer_reviews.title: REPAIR
customer_reviews.text: A WORD ABOUT MUCK BOOTS, I WILL KEEP IT SIMPLE! THEY ARE GOOD BOOTS I HAVE OWNED MANY STYLES. OVER TIME THEY CAN CRACK (THEY ARE RUBBER NOT LEATHER) THEY CAN EASILY BE REPAIRED WITH BLACK SHOO GOO SOLD ON AMAZON! SIMPLY CLEAN THE AREA AND ADD A GENEROUS AMOUNT OF SHOO GOO, THEY WILL BE GOOD FOR ANOTHER YEAR! :)
customer_reviews.author: KEVINMAGIK

customer_reviews.title: They are comfortable, they breathe properly without sacrificing on warmth
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these boots! And he puts them through the ringer! He is hard on these boots and they hold up fantastically! This is only the 2nd pair he has owned in more than 10 years so that should tell you of their durability. We own a small hobby farm and with the messy fall and springs we have, not to mention the absurd winters, he winds up using these year round! They are comfortable, they breathe properly without sacrificing on warmth. We always recommend Muck Boots!!
customer_reviews.author: Faith Ann

customer_reviews.title: Seems to have the wrong men to women size reference ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to have the wrong men to women size reference. Usually, a women 8 is a men 6, but here it's mapped to men 7. I didn't know to go with the women size or the men size. Turned out I should have gone with the men sizing. I am a women 8 it was too big because a men 7 is big. Women should be a men 6. I had to exchange for the women 7/men 6.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: ... warm are Mickey Mouse boots ad muck boots arctic love them my feet have been warm since I got ...
customer_reviews.text: So mad at myself for being such a frugal fool I work outside all day in northeast Ohio my feet are always cold only boots that keep me warm are Mickey Mouse boots ad muck boots arctic love them my feet have been warm since I got these fits as expected I wear a 13 shoe and 13 boot
customer_reviews.author: Nick d.

customer_reviews.title: 2004 and all were real good, fit properly
customer_reviews.text: While the boots fit, the calf is far too tight and I had to remove the top binding. I have used Muck boots since Jan., 2004 and all were real good, fit properly, up until my last 2 pairs. For some reason Muck started finishing the tops of the boots with a decidedly smaller binding on the tops. While this binding has some stretch, it actually wears a sore into my shins. Until the last 2 pair (and I buy a new pair once or even twice some years) I had no issues with the top fit until the last 2. By the way, I am the same weight as I have been since 2004 +/- maybe 5 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Useless if you are operating ANY motor vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, useless in practice. Way too thick and inflexible to even think about operating any type of motor vehicle in. I am out if my 30 day return window so it looks like I’ve got a pair of rustic “planters”. Not happy. Bought a pair of chore boots and they are great. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie B.

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted ONE season
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my regular, non-winter Muck boots. They are probably 15 years old, so when my husband wanted a good winter boot, I bought these winter Muck boots. He really liked them until just recently when he noticed his foot getting wet. As you can see from the picture, the boot cracked. I bought these for him in January 2017. He did not use them until 2018. He wanted to use his old boots until they were dead, which he did, and did not put his Muck boots into use until late fall/winter 2018. Now they are cracked. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bhlee

customer_reviews.title: Wrong height.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the tall but received the mids. Had to keep anyway because other pair leaking at the sole. Both pair are Artic Sport. Picture seen wearing new pair with old standing beside.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Marie

customer_reviews.title: Finally a solution to my cold feet in winter!
customer_reviews.text: features I like best; - toasty warm with combined layers of CR-foam, structured breathable airmesh lining and arctic fleece preventing sweat and moisture build-up, active comfort range -40 to 60 F - comfortable and waterproof top to bottom, lightweight, flexible and buoyant - love the slip-on/off CR-foam that stretches to facilitate on/off, no laces, buckles or velcro to mess with especially when coming back inside covered in snow - great sure-grip, non-slip sole bottoms with deep rubber lugs - the perfect height, mid/upper-calf - easy clean-up, since with water
customer_reviews.author: TP99978

customer_reviews.title: my favorite...for a while
customer_reviews.text: I live in interior Alaska. These are the best winter boots I've had for temps down to 0 F. I like warm feet. If you are walking as opposed to snowmobile riding you can go even colder and be toasty. Military Bunny Boots are good to lower temps but are bulky and heavy. These are much lighter and the fit is comfy. Unfortunately, the last two pairs I have purchased have cracked and split on the outer layer, not leaking water but not looking good and I'm wondering now if other boot manufacturers don't have this problem. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: rojo

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT---Comfortable and WARM
customer_reviews.text: GREAT GREAT BOOT, bought this for freezing temperatures--WOW what a comfortable and warm boot. The way the boot is poured allows my step with a SPRING in my stride --- the boot rocks and puts me on a cloud. Wicked temperatures can not even penetrate this boot. I HIGHLY Recommend the boot! THANK YOU
customer_reviews.author: AKS

customer_reviews.title: Fits and feels great. Can't say it's any warmer than the chore boots.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because they are supposed to be warmer than the chore boots. They fignsnd feel good. Are definetly stuffed than the chore boots because of the thicker neoprene but I started to feel my feet getting cold with these and my darn tough expededition wool socks on after an hour of sitting in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great boots & Well Made
customer_reviews.text: I really like these boots. They are easy to get on and off and well insulated so your feet stay warm. They are also completely waterproof so you don’t have to worry about snoe getting in. One of their best qualities is that you can wear them above or below your pants. The top is stretchy so you can tuck your pants in and they won’t get wet. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B-Man

customer_reviews.title: Converted flatlander
customer_reviews.text: I live in Vermont and MuckBoots and BOGS are all the rage. I resisted the urge for years, thinking they couldn't possibly be comfortable or warm. Man was I wrong. These are the warmest and most comfortable winter boots I've ever had. I assumed slip on boots couldn't fit well enough to stay in place for hiking or intense winter activity, but again I was proven completely wrong. I now understand why everyone loves these things. They seem durable enough to last for years, but when they finally need to be replaced, rest assured it will be with another pair of these.
customer_reviews.author: flinchball

customer_reviews.title: Great working boots
customer_reviews.text: If you're standing in cold mud or snow for long periods for work, these are a great choice. They feel pretty light and have some air flow but keep you warm enough without feeling tight and sweaty. Don't forget to get a half size up so you can wear a thicker sock.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Length and toe area was good however around the top of my foot in front ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size larger than I wear (81/2 wide). Length and toe area was good however around the top of my foot in front of my ankle was so tight I could hardly get them on. I did try to wear them, my feet swelled up within the first hour and my feet were freezing. I finally had to have someone pull them off. I did not try to return them (as I had wore them) so I gave them to my daughter I have not heard back from her, however they were not tight on her feet.
customer_reviews.author: Nettie

customer_reviews.title: easy slip on and off
customer_reviews.text: My foot size is 10 1⁄2 & 11 1⁄2 EEE (5 inches wide) with having broken both ankles I have limited motion, no problem there, easy slip on and off. No more lacing boots for my bad back! I ordered size 12. Perfect fit with room for heavy socks (which I didn’t need) They are warm. They are so lightweight, I didn’t even think about these “new boots” until after 1.5 hrs. of Snow Throwing. Ankle support is about 3 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for normal to moderate wear.
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat these. I bought them for mucking my horse stalls, but I wear them 5-6 days per week to snowshoe 2-3 miles, and they are the warmest, most-comfortable boots I've ever owned. I have very wide feet, and most women's boots don't fit comfortably. These stretch to fit your foot. Plus they are 100% water proof. I did buy them for one of my farm employees, and he wore them for 6-8 hour days 5 days/week. He is much harder on boots than me. He wore through his in one winter...his toe came through.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it. Others wrote Muck brand boots retain some resale value.
customer_reviews.text: Turns out the "removable sock liner" is a misnomer; Muck is referring to the insole. Big difference. Bought sock liner separately and that remedied the little slippage I experienced. Easy to slip on/off. Stood in an ankle-deep slush puddle for a few minutes and my feet stayed warm & dry.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Sole Separation on both boots
customer_reviews.text: I sent the first pair back after 1 week and now the replacement set is doing the same thing, sole separates from the upper boot getting your feet wet now they will not take them back. don't buy MUCK boots!
customer_reviews.author: john turpin

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite boots. They are perfect for colder weather. Not too heavy to lift and fit is great. You can wear heavier socks with them if you want - but beware - they keep your feet so warm, they will sweat!
customer_reviews.author: Marci Rinehart

customer_reviews.title: Better than regular Boots
customer_reviews.text: Being the very first pair of this type boot. I am very surprised over all. Fits exactly like I expected , the comfort level is better than thought. Have put them to the test and they (boots) didn’t let me down. Could wear them like slippers and do to let dogs out to play. May buy another pair
customer_reviews.author: Hylnder64

customer_reviews.title: Very warm!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband for our cold Iowa winter this year. He is loving them! I bought him the size he usually wears in shoes, they fit great. He said they are warm and a great fit. He did not want/need they knee height ones, so these are perfect for him.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fits large
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews on this product about it fitting small and to order a half size bigger. I wear a 12.5 so stepping up to a 13 is not unheard of for me, but with all the room in these boots I actually need to go down to a 12. These don't fit like normal boots. They fit like you would think a big rain boot would fit, big.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Plummer

customer_reviews.title: New Boots
customer_reviews.text: These replace my 20+ year old boots. I like that they just slip on. They allow room for a thicker sock. Can't wait to wear them, once colder weather is here.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Warm feet are happy feet.
customer_reviews.text: My feet will not mind the harsh rural winter they are about to encounter wearing these. I have an outdoor wood boiler for my heating my home. Making my way to the boiler in the middle of winter is going to be a lot easier with these on my feet keeping them warm and giving me great traction through the ice and snow.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Kirkwood

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: A little expensive but worth every penny. My fiance is a masonry foreman. He needed something to keep his feet dry and warm with all the rain we've had. Down in the muddy footers pumping out water these Muck boots have kept his feet dry and warm. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: April N

customer_reviews.title: Warm and dry!
customer_reviews.text: We live in the north east and during brutal winters of working construction outdoors these boot are the best by far! After spend so much money on so call quality work boots over the years I have finally found one that gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Jcsaguiar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Antarctica and any cold weather
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots, completely waterproof and super warm. If you are between sizes pick the higher number. I'm a 7.5 - which - I bought and returned because it was too tight. I got the 8 and it fits like a glove, with room for comfy socks. I found the brand in an Antarctic expedition and fell in love with them. No matter the conditions (water, snow and ice) my feet were always warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: lili

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I waited so long to get them
customer_reviews.text: Once I put my Arch supports in, these are perfect! They are comfortable, very warm, and easy to slip on and off. Just wish I'd have purchased the tall ones instead of mids.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Was looking for warm boots
customer_reviews.text: As much as these bots cost me I was not too happy with them! I obviously got wrong size but had wore them so I couldn't return them and was only too small on my right foot had trouble getting on and off in warmer temps especially around top of foot area towards ankle and freezing temps my feet did not stay warm so was not very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy these boots!
customer_reviews.text: Very warm even in single digit temperatures. Boots are made to fit with a thick pair of socks so if you are a size 9 and you don't wear thick socks, buy an 8-8 1/2. Totally waterproof... I have walked through streams without any moisture. Awesome boots for snow and mud! I would not plan on using these boots for hiking or extended walks. They are a bit clunky until you get used to them. Just a bit heavy but I love them for their warmth and comfort. They are great for still hunting, snowmobiling or ATVing.
customer_reviews.author: Forest Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Still provide adequate coverage compared to the taller model. Much easier to take off!
customer_reviews.text: Muck boots run a little large, so if you're a half size, I'd recommend sizing down. Also keep in mind how thick the socks are that you'll be wearing. So far so good. Of course, as soon as the boots got delivered, the snow melted.
customer_reviews.author: _boom

customer_reviews.title: Great boot!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the boots! I'm a size 10 in work boot and I got a size 11 in these boots. It was the perfect size! They where big enough to slip on, but not to big to move around on your feet. Had enough room to put extra socks on if needed. Very worm boot, so I'm not thinking I'll need extra socks. They are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Jones

customer_reviews.title: comfy easy to put on boot
customer_reviews.text: thus far have been used to sit in the stand on a few mild days, did some work around the homestead! I feel that the tread should be deeper for snow but I didn't slip around too bad as of yet! I will likely add to this as time goes on!
customer_reviews.author: blown455

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves these boots
customer_reviews.text: Husband has always wanted some of these so finally got them for his birthday. That's been over a year ago and they are holding up well. Warm and comfortable and easy to put on. They're his "go to" boots anytime he's headed out the back door in bad weather.
customer_reviews.author: J. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: love there boots
customer_reviews.text: love there boots!!!! I work outside in rain, sleet and snow in often freezing temps and these boots are the ONLY ones to keep my feet warm for almost the entire day. Best part is my feet NEVER get wet....my job requires me to often stand in one place in the same spot for up to 10 hours a day, these boots really were able to rise up to and maintain that standard.
customer_reviews.author: Ali-Kat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boots!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best boots on the market!!! My son de-ices airplanes at the airport, lots on slush and snow. Warm feet!!!! Dry feet!!! And super fast shipping!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie D.

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable for me
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow foot and I found the boots to still be a little narrow. Also because they are made of a heavier durable rubber like material they do not bend too well at the ball of your foot. I found them to be uncomfortable and returned.
customer_reviews.author: guy m

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. Warm, comfortable, and fit well. They are a little hard to get on, but once on, the fit fine. I ordered a size larger than I should have, but I have to do that for everything I buy as a result of a military injury where I broke my leg. Swelling has never gone down. I have not had the chance to really put these to the super cold test yet for a long period, but I will They were mainly bought for snow blowing an shoveling in Iowa, where we have had a miserably long winter. From what I can tell thus far, I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Chadima F.

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots for snowmobiling but also wanted to be able to wear them when I’m not riding. I’ve been a fan of muck boots for a long time! These keep your feet very warm and dry even when standing in the snow for awhile! The first couple times wearing them are kind of uncomfortable but that’s with any new boot. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Genna

customer_reviews.title: Muck Boots
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how warm they will be, but they seem comfy. Length wise they are good they are a bit side though. Will have to wear a thicker than normal sock, should be ok though after all they are winter boots the extra sock thickness shouldn't hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: It fits a little big, but the boots are so awesome I won't take a star off. They're so comfy and easy to put on, sometimes I wear them to get the mail or take out the trash. Out in a ton of snow is where they really shine though.
customer_reviews.author: The Casey Family

customer_reviews.title: Not warm enough
customer_reviews.text: I really was hoping that these would be super warm while sitting in my treestand for hours at a time on frigid mornings. There not quite as good as what I thought they would be. A little disappointed
customer_reviews.author: bjrobbins37

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband in a size 11. He normally wears a 10 1/2E so I didn't want to size down. They are too big but if he wears thick socks, the heal doesn't slip. The are warm, waterproof and have good traction.
customer_reviews.author: jen3

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and take off
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his muck boots sports. Normally, it is hard to get him to wear snow boots, but these he absolutely loves. Easy to put on and take off. Also said it does keep his feet warm.
customer_reviews.author: ADRIENNE L

customer_reviews.title: He loves them! I want them!
customer_reviews.text: Got them for my husband. He adds his own arch support that was made for him. He said they keep his toes warm and fit great. Easy to get on and off with his bad back.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Velez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent muck boots
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, we have a horse farm in Massachusetts and my husband love these boots, we get a new pair on average every other year , keep is feet warm and still have room for winter socks, , good for snow , rainy days keep your feet warm,
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Bonenfant

customer_reviews.title: The only winter boot for me.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have used Muck Arctic Sport for years when snowmobiling. We also bought these for our kids when they became teenagers. I have the tall version but suggest going with mid-height as they a more typical height. These boots perform as well as others that are twice the price and they are simple pull on/off without any laces to mess with.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old rubber boots with a pair of these boots. I received the correct size boots, yet, they fit tight, compared to my old boots. I would recommend ordering the next size larger, when making a purchase. I put a pair of chemical toe heaters in the bottoms, yet, they didn't heat up, because no air got to them. I took the insoles out, so I could take the boots off easier. The good news is my feet never got cold, after working outdoors for several hours in sub-zero weather.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Warm, dry, but... not super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm gonna be honest, it's not the most comfortable shoes I own, but it get the job done. I mean, keep me warm, dry (this year I used them in -35 °C in Chicago, so yes, they are gonna keep you warm and dry!), and I feel pretty safe I'm not gonna fall because of the ice... So if you are looking something super comfortable probably you should keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Jonnathan Javier

customer_reviews.title: Half sizes needed
customer_reviews.text: Too bad there are no half sizes as I am in between. They do seem to be well made, but I felt a strange notch against my heel in both sizes. I think it is there to keep the boot on, but it is not something I am used to.
customer_reviews.author: KBT

customer_reviews.title: Great boot up size when you order
customer_reviews.text: Sent back and reorded larger size. Because they are so insulated had to upsize. My husband wears 9 1/2shoe ordered and 11. He wears thick socks so they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: dakotabAW

customer_reviews.title: Love These!
customer_reviews.text: Liked the first pair I purchased for use at our weekend home so much, I bought a second pair for home! Great for winters in Ohio. Good traction in snow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice warm dry boot.
customer_reviews.text: I work outside several hours and they keep my feet warm and dry. Easy to get on and off, maybe a little to easy. I normally wear an 8.5, Muckboots do not come in half sizes so I ordered a 9. Even with heavy socks they slip a little on the heel so walking a long distance is a little uncomfortable. My concern is that the heel will wear out on the inside before the boots wear out on the outside. But I still like the boot, time will tell...
customer_reviews.author: ezreader

customer_reviews.title: Warm Feet!!
customer_reviews.text: MuckBoots are the go to boot around here in Maine when you want warm feet. If you can afford them, and they are a worthy investment, they are the best for keeping feet warm whether you are in the snow or on the ice. We all have them and wouldn't be without. And they are comfortable which is almost as important as warmth. Another brand, when tried on, didn't match these in comfort at all. I am a woman but these fit me perfectly and allow for good socks which is also important. Sometimes I wish they were a little more stylish but when you are standing on the ice or snow, style is much less important than warm feet.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is if you wear them for a long time they do tend to chafe at the top. But definitely worth buying
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Warm dry and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: If your an outdoors person you need you some Muck boots! Living on a small farm and being an avid outdoors person I can assure you I put my various pairs of muck boots through the paces. They wont let you down and these artic sports are no exception. Warm dry and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: BSM

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with the construction and fit
customer_reviews.text: The Original Arctic Sport Mid Outdoor Boots by MuckBoots were just what my husband expected. He was looking for an insulated and sturdy boot for working in the yard and cutting fire wood this winter. Luckily, he hasn't had to test them out shoveling snow yet, but he anxiously awaiting it. Overall, he's very pleased with the construction and fit of these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Mini410

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots, I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: These boots are pretty good very comfortable I don't believe the -60° rating my feet were getting cold in the single digits but I use these for hunting so that's a different scenario. Over all these boots are pretty good and very comfortable. Over all their good Boots, High-quality, & I would recommend. Lastly I did feel like the boots were a little big but this was a plus because I could put two pairs of socks on to help insulate better.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Muck boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a present for my husband, he is very happy with these!! Great boots have gotten muck boots in the past excellent product great price very fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting Comfortable Winter/Mud Work Boots.
customer_reviews.text: I found out about these boots after helping at a friend's farm and using their pair before buying my oun 8 years ago. I needed a new pair after 7 Vermont winters of just using these boots. They are warm in the cold, but not sweaty in mud season. Really comfortable and supportive. When my old pair finally wore out I ordered exactly the same ones.
customer_reviews.author: Cmhn

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the warmest
customer_reviews.text: My Husband loves his boots, he said they keep his feet super warm and the size is perfect. Wish we would have bought them years ago !
customer_reviews.author: sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Warm and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Warm and Comfortable - easy to slip on, waterproof and good traction on ice.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Be sure of fit.
customer_reviews.text: Mens 11 right boot was too tight on toes with wool socks on. Left boot felt good with wool socks on. Sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: D.C. the Fluff

customer_reviews.title: Warm rubber boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots seem to run small. Had to go up a size from normal. I can say that I was surprised by how warm they are for a rubber boot. Keeps my feet warm in Wisconsin winters.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: OMG!  The Greatest Boots
customer_reviews.text: The fit great and keep your feet warm. Very well made and are easy to clean. What more do you need? Buy them already.
customer_reviews.author: tiggermom

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort & support!
customer_reviews.text: the boots are a great fit and comfortable. They can be worn in inclement weather to/for work as well as in the barn. they have great versatility and will help keep the feet warm in the winter. They can also be worn in warmer weather with the softness and cushioning in them w/out socks if needed. I have a very high arch, these fit well without having a zipper, etc. and that is a challenge I typically face. The toe box could be a tad wider, think about the width if you have a wider front foot.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Kay

customer_reviews.title: Insulated Muck Boots
customer_reviews.text: I really like these boots. They keep my feet dry & warm in winter.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Klafter

customer_reviews.title: great value at a great price
customer_reviews.text: probably the best boot I have ever bought for the cold weather
customer_reviews.author: JoeyP

customer_reviews.title: MuckBoot Arctic Sport Boot
customer_reviews.text: I ice fish every weekend and this year Michigan has been very cold. I purchased these boots due to the cold and the slush on the inland lakes. These boots are very light and my feet have stayed warm and dry throughout the day. Although I sit in a portable ice shack my feet still sometimes rest in sloppy slush, but don't have to worry about it anymore. I will definitely wear these boots for muzzleloading season.
customer_reviews.author: Romby

customer_reviews.title: great fit and warm
customer_reviews.text: These boots live up to the reputation they have, They are the best boots going.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to muck out horse stalls and they’re fantastic! So comfortable and keep my feet warm in the NJ winter. I’m usually a Women’s 7.5 and am happy I sized down to a 7. Perfect fit
customer_reviews.author: Matt and Renee Miller

customer_reviews.title: Rubbed Me Raw!
customer_reviews.text: Amazons return policy is first rate they get the 3 stars. This style boot “mid calf” rubbed both of my shins raw after an extended period of clearing snow. This was due to a hard spot inside the front of the boot that rubbed my shin through my pants. Boots were warm with good traction but unwearable.
customer_reviews.author: JonP

customer_reviews.title: Honestly waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a women's size 61/2-7; these were a bit large, so I added some gel insoles and they fit much better. I was looking for something waterproof with cleats because my backyard is hilly. These were perfect- very good whether in snow or mud. I left them outside all winter, but when I put them on, warmed up immediately. They are a bit slippery on flat ice surfaces. Otherwise I'm very pleased. I bought my husband a pair too.
customer_reviews.author: kwhite

customer_reviews.title: Great boots. Replaced my Bogs
customer_reviews.text: These replaced a pair of similar Bog Books I had. The tracking and insulation on these is much better. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Joz

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these!! They keep his feet very warm and dry. After reading all the reviews about them fitting smaller than normal, I went up a size and ended up having to return them. Got him his regular size and he still has room. Great with a pair of thick socks!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki W

customer_reviews.title: Great boots! Comfortable,  warm and dry!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! They are very warm and extremely comfortable! I love the fact they are waterproof! I live in northern Michigan with very cold winters. These boots keep my feet warm and dry through the cold of winter and the cold wet of spring! I will continue to purchase muck brand boots in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Boots wonderfully warm
customer_reviews.text: These boots replaced some very expensive logger style boots that my sons wears on the job. While the others were warm they did not keep his feet dry...water resistant not waterproof. The only drawback to these is that they are not good for walking on uneven ground. My son is a field engineer for a site development company, so there are many uneven surfaces. His feet do not sweat as others said they would with a rubber boot. Nice warm, waterproof boot.
customer_reviews.author: Paula A. Siok

customer_reviews.title: My feet say thanks
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for all my farm duties in northern Missouri winter. Love them so far, we’ll see about longevity
customer_reviews.author: NatsInMo

customer_reviews.title: they fit great. I am very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am using these for cold weather fishing. I bought them in 10 for my 8.5 foot. With a thick wool sock, they fit great. I am very happy with my purchase. My feet stay warm in them. I wouldn't trust them much below 30 degrees or so unless you are active.
customer_reviews.author: NorcalRob

customer_reviews.title: Husband's Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: As a hobby farmer in Maine, it gets really cold and really muddy. My husband's old rubber boots (cheap ones from TSC) were just not cutting it so I bought him these for a Christmas gift. He loves them! They are super warm (he even uses them when shoveling) and grip pretty well on slippery surfaces. I think they were worth every penny! After months of hard use they still look brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!
customer_reviews.text: Best Boot EVER!!! * inches of SNOW and my feet where warm and super DRY. Love them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: My wife has cold feet no more
customer_reviews.text: My wife has (had!) perpetually cold feet in our Maine winters and we've tried many different winter boots even battery powered with no success. Finally, these boots have solved the problem - they are warm, waterproof, can be worn with snowshoes and they fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Barkdoll

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I got a pair near the end of winter. I love them. Very high quality and very water proof. I got them hoping for warm boots to go ice fishing in (I always get numb feet,) and although later than normal, my feet started hurting after a few hours on a frozen lake in Michigan - hence 4 stars. Keep in mind, my feet have poor circulation, and I was just sitting around and not moving.
customer_reviews.author: Joni M. Morse

customer_reviews.title: love my mucks!
customer_reviews.text: got these for the fantastic review and I have to say ... these are crazy good in the winter time. they're warm and like they say waterproof. I guess if there was mud or "muck" I would wear them in the summertime too.. but my mucks are mostly for the winter type "muck" it's a gentle pleasure to be able to get these.
customer_reviews.author: Mark and Julie in Waukesha

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These boots are so comfortable and completely waterproof, as well as warm.
customer_reviews.author: Pixie

customer_reviews.title: Warm boot
customer_reviews.text: My husband has thick calved legs. These rub a bit, but think they’ll stretch with wear.
customer_reviews.author: whitetail

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I wear them in -30* and my feet stay to warm.
customer_reviews.author: Rufus M. Arroyo

customer_reviews.title: Good fit , great grip .
customer_reviews.text: Kept my feet nice and warm while clearing my driveway of 12” of snow .
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Goergen

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but I wish for half sizes
customer_reviews.text: I'm normally a W7, and I really liked these boots...we live on a farm, but mostly these would have been for cold and wet weather walking the dogs. They are a very nice quality and comfortable, but....I'm between sizes, no if-ands-or-buts...I need them to fit well, and the 6 was too snug, while the 7 was too big. If they fit you, you will likely be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Melle12

customer_reviews.title: Keeps feet warm and dry. Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Keeps foot warm and dry. The mid calf is so much easier for pulling off /on. Love them. They are well made and worth the price. They do not hurt foot like other boots I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: LANE JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: I won't have Frozen Feet this season!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn the uninsulated MuckBoots for the last 3 deer seasons but last year we had temps in the single digits & had to leave early sue to numb feet. Not this year!! These insulated boots fit really nice - just a bit large so I can wear thicker socks, which is perfect. This much quality in a boot which is affordable is great.
customer_reviews.author: DBnKC

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I work in new residential construction and these are great boots. Keep my feet dry and warm. Make sure you get good quality wool socks to wear with them otherwise your feet will sweat. DO NOT wear cotton socks if you are going to pretty active while wearing them, as with any boot for that matter. Also, in my opinion, the mid length helps them breath better than the full length version.
customer_reviews.author: Michael DeRusso

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps feet dry and warm, have had no issues since purchasing and boots are holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaM

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Fit is on point. Comfortable. Warm. Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

product_meta.title: Muck Boot Arctic Sport Rubber High Performance Men's Winter Boot
product_meta.description:
Ideal for outdoor work or leisure activities during frigid weather, Muck Arctic Sport Rubber High Performance Men's Winter Boots will keep your feet warm in temperatures as low as -40 °F (-40°C), even when you're standing ankle deep in snow and slush. Offering both support and comfort, these insulated boots have a contoured midsole and warm fleece lining with thermal foam under the footbed. The 5 mm neoprene in these men's snow boots offers numerous benefits: it's waterproof, it absorbs shock, retains heat and prevents chafing by adjusting to the natural contours of the feet. These men's winter boots with molded lugs are built with a fully-sealed rubber shell that extends high above the ankle for extra protection when walking in deeper snow.

Make the Arctic-like conditions your playground in this sporty boot from Muck Boots. Lightweight, well insulated, and sure to keep your feet warm and comfy as the Mercury dips, this sturdy boot offers 100% waterproof protection, keeping snow, ice, and slush at bay with ease. Its upper shaft stretches for a close under- or over-the-pants fit. A breathable lining wicks moisture away for a comfy, dry feel, while the molded rubber outsole keeps you steady on your feet.

The story began in 1999 with the sole purpose of building the most comfortable, high performance footwear on the market. The need for a more comfortable boot for use in messy and tough conditions led to the design of The Original Muck Boot Company brand footwear. Every boot in the line is expected to deliver the same 100% waterproof quality and comfort that inspired the original footwear. In just a few years, the line has grown to more than 20 styles, all designed to tackle tough conditions in agriculture, lawn and garden, outdoor sporting, equine, and pet care. Today, the Muck Boot brand defines a standard of comfort and quality that goes beyond the expectations of customers around the country.

See more
feature_bullets: 5 mm neoprene provides comfort and flexibility, along with excellent waterproofing, shock absorption and heat retention properties; adjusts to your foot shape to resist blisters and chafing
Completely sealed rubber shell extends up above ankle area for added protection from moisture
Fleece lining is soft, durable and provides exceptional warmth in frigid environments; 2 mm of thermal foam under footbed; comfort rated from -40 °F to 40 °F (-40°C to 4°C)
Outsole with rugged molded lugs for increased traction on slippery and uneven terrain
100% waterproof winter boots; EVA contoured, molded midsole for increased support
